title: EPISTOLA Doug Hoylman
html:
EPISTOLA Doug Hoylman

In “Words: the Stealth Weapon of War” in the Summer 2002 VERBATIM (Vol. XXVII/3) Howard Richler erroneously states that the War Department of the U.S. became the Navy Department. In fact, the former was founded in 1789 and the latter in 1798, and the two coexisted (the War Department consisting only of the Army) until they were merged into the Defense Department in 1947.

[Doug Hoylman, Chevy Chase, Maryland]
